text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Dreamcast is a home game console developed by Sega to succeed the Saturn. Launching November 1998 in Japan, it is the first sixth generation console preceding PS2 and XBOX to offer an online play experience. Unfortunately it ended prematurely in 2004, remaining the last console of SEGAs because of a bad marketing reputation. Itâ€™s equipped with a 32-bit processor that includes a 128-bit arithmetic coprocessor, 16 MB of RAM, and a NEC PowerVR2 GPU to display 7 million polygons per second with 16 million colors. Similar to NAOMI arcade system boards.
